channel.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
channel.description:
[quote="Comrade Tiki"] Started driving 'er in January, but I think she's still pimp-worthy.
[img]https://img190.imageshack.us/img190/5905/sexualchocolate.jpg[/img] [/quote] She... is no more.
Someone going 65 (in a 35 mph zone) decided to go off the road into my apartment complex's parking area, at 03:45 in the morning last night.
He swiped one car's tail light, totaled my trunk (rotating my car 80 degrees from how it was parked), brought my car into the rear of a Mazda 6 (crushing that irreparably, too), and continued into a fourth car, a full-size Buick.
That Buick was pressed into the minivan beyond it.
It gets better.
These cars were parked alongside the building. By hitting my beautiful car so ferociously, he sent my vehicle's front through a one-foot thick brick-&-cinder-block wall next to my window. (I like to park where I can see my car from bed, you see.)
The bed was just inside that window, head to the glass. There is a very real possibility that I would have been killed if I had been in bed sleeping then instead of living a nocturnal lifestyle.
I might post some video to YouTube later.

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
In the foliage behind the dumpster, yes. How did you know?

Read full topic

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Dr_Strangelove
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

The day’s miraculous heat allowed me to discard of the lizard without any guilt.

You’re heartless.

Read full topic
item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
It sat comfortably on top of a warm computer overnight.

The warming sun of the new day drove the night’s bitter coolth away. The day’s miraculous heat allowed me to discard of the lizard without any guilt, at the wood and brush on the opposite end of the building.

Did you know that despite every other pigmented surface of the anole being able to turn brown, the eyelids remain fully green?

Read full topic
item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
I’ve always hated the idea of owning a pet for the immense responsibility, but knowing that you saved its life originally kind of takes some slack off - like you could just forget to feed it some day and still be the good guy.

Okay I’m being really sardonic tonight.

Read full topic
item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
I caught an anole tonight. I think it came inside from the side of the building in order to escape the cold.

I was about to release it, but I made the mistake of rinsing my hands before doing so. The cold felt biting, and I didn’t have the heart to leave it helpless out there-- it was smart enough to come inside, so it doesn’t deserve to die of exposure tonight.

Read full topic
item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
My barbie car has a 2mm scratch on my right door because some twat sucked at parking and didn’t have enough room to open his door.

Fuck my life.

Read full topic

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Here’s a post for the curious. Photos from when I went to gather belongings from my car.

This looks familiar!! It’s pretty messy (but overall intact). Note the Tiki air-freshener hanging from the mirror. Note half of a CD-case on the seat (bonus-points if you can identify it).[indent][/indent]

Uh, what’s wrong with the back-seat:[indent][/indent]

Okay, this view is NOT how I remember it:[indent][/indent]

Oh no, my beautiful car has been mauled! Surely this is the ugliest damage:[indent][/indent]

I was wrong:[indent][/indent]

Read full topic

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Dr. Strangelove:

Imagine if he really was hit.
And his posts just stopped.

Would you question his absence?

How many have we already lost?

I approve of this sentiment. The internet is weird like that.

A friend of mine pointed out that the track-record “ghosts” in Mario Kart Wii will still be playable in 100 years, allowing future-folk to race against dead ghost-racers of the past.

Read full topic
item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
You were lucky Tiki. Stupid people doing stupid shit while made stupider by the influence of alcohol is one of the main causes of mortality around the world.

Stay safe bro and try to avoid getting in the way of stupid people.

item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily

item.title: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
DonMelpomene:

wow. If this guy wasn’t in the gutter to begin with, he’s certainly gonna be it now ._.

He’s just two years older than me, I realize your concern-- but he listed his “Religious Views” on Facebook as “Arizona Diamondbacks” so I have a feeling he wasn’t the next Socrates.

DonMelpomene:

What’s gonna happen if that man is unable to provide you with the funds for a wall repair?

Fortunately that wall is important to the building, and condominium association, as a whole-- which is well insured.

Damages inside might not be given as much attention (I’m hoping the damage to the doorframe is covered)… but the exterior wall and window are accounted for.

Ryλn:

I bet the driver just stepped out of his truck hammered and got the fuck outta there quick. He knew he was in deep shit and prolly fled the scene. and by fleeing the scene, I mean limping away from all the cars he totalled.

Did the driver stay at the crash or was he gone before everyone came to investigate?

He walked toward where he had crossed offroad in order to enter the parking lot, which brought him out of view of the cameras which recorded the accident,
but he was was recorded walking back toward the complex (in a big curve) where a resident (on his way out to view the crash) spotted him.

After he passed this resident, he made a weird gesture… looking down toward his forearm and holding his fist in front of him (palm upwards)…
which I loosely believe represents the realization of “fuck, I’m not getting out of this”.

He walked past the mailboxes and made a big circle back toward the truck (whose engine was somehow still idling). He stood to the side and explained that he was just a passenger, and tried suggesting that the real driver ran off after the crash.

Obviously not a very good alibi. A neighbor immediately noticed that the armrest between the passenger- and driver-seat was still down (which should have been lifted if a passenger were to have crossed over and gotten out of the vehicle on the driver’s side, which he’d’ve had to-- considering what remained of my car was on his passenger-side).

Read full topic
item.source: You can't get rid of me THAT easily
